gut.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: all the organs in someone’s body, especially when they have come out of their body
gut.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: There were blood and guts all over the place.
gut.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the tube through which food passes from your stomach
gut.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: It can take 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
gut.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: someone’s stomach, especially when it is large
gut.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He felt as if someone had just kicked him in the gut.
Phil has a huge beer gut  (=unattractive fat stomach caused by drinking too much beer).
gut.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a type of strong string made from the intestine of an animal, and used for musical instruments such as violins
gut.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to completely destroy the inside of a building, especially by fire
gut.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The building was gutted by fire.
gut.translation[1].definitions[0].note_b: Gut is often passive in this meaning
gut.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to remove the organs from inside a fish or animal in order to prepare it for cooking
gut.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to change something by removing some of the most important or central parts
